newsitem.title: FRANCE: BASKETBALL-VILLEURBANNE FIGHT BACK TO EARN REPRIEVE.
newsitem.headline: BASKETBALL-VILLEURBANNE FIGHT BACK TO EARN REPRIEVE.

text.p: France's Villeurbanne fought back from four points down at half-time to beat Efes Pilsen Istanbul 80-70 on Tuesday and keep alive their hopes of making it to the Final Four of the men's basketball EuroLeague.
Their hard-fought win owed more to nerves than skill but allowed the French outsiders to return to Turkey on Thursday for a decisive third leg in front of Istanbul's vociferous fans.
It was an uphill battle led by French international Jim Bilba, who scored 19 points, as the Turks, who won the first leg 87-71, led from the start.
But Villeurbanne, who have repeatedly upset the favourites in their march to the quarter-finals, hauled themselves back into the match and edged ahead 51-50 after 27 minutes.
Georgy Adams stepped in for the inefficient American Delaney Rudd to lead the game on the half-hour but there was still much to do.
The Turks brought the scores level at 61-61 with eight minutes left but the home side stayed calm.
Istanbul tired in the closing minutes and, despite another fine showing by Russia's Vassili Karassev, who scored 14 points, were eventually over-run.
